message:
Do you like Sam's Pizza? India House? Herrell's Ice Cream? Bruegger's Bagels? Teapot? Free drinks? Free stuff? 

Would you like to win $50 for learning how to code? Or enter to win $100 for creating that awesome app you've always wanted to make? 

Then you should register for Hack At Smith at www.hackatsmith.org today!

story: Smithies in Computer Science created an event.
Smithies in Computer Science created an event.

message:
Julia here. Exciting news! Smithies in CS is a finalist for the Anita Borg Institute Student of Vision award! I made a video about how this club was started, and the important work we strive to do here at Smith College, and the ABI selected the video to be presented at the Women of Vision Awards Banquet in May. I'll be there amongst several other award winners, including my co-finalist from the University of Sa\u0303o Paulo.

You can view the video at: //www.youtube.com/watch?v=gy_cZxq0XZ0 and read the press release at: http://anitaborg.org/news/press-release/visionary-women-leaders-in-tech-recognized-by-the-anita-borg-institute/.

Thank you to everyone who supports me and this club every day. We're making strides in closing the gender gap in tech!

message:
Come listen to a wonderful talk on Tech Feminism with Twitter employee and Smith College alumna Beth Andres-Beck ('05). We hope to see you all there!

Friday, February 13 @ 4pm in Ford Hall 241
Great work CS Smithies!  Looks like you are growing by leaps and bounds.

Feeling the urge to create something new and exciting? We have the event for you! Hack@Smith: Closing the Gender G(app) is Smith College\u2019s premier hackathon. Sponsored by Smith\u2019s Computer Science club, \u201cSmithies in CS\u201d, students from all over the east coast will be invited to Smith\u2019s campus for our 24-hour hackathon in March. We hope to see you there!

To learn more and to RSVP please visit: http://www.hackatsmith.org/

story: Smithies in Computer Science added 19 new photos to the album: SCS Holiday Party 2014.

message:
Smithies in Computer Science Holiday Party!

Hot chocolate bar...
Friday...
CC TV Lounge...
4 p.m.

In need of a study break? You're in luck!

Smithies in Computer Science is going to have our first-ever holiday
party in the CC TV lounge this Friday, December 12th at 4PM! 

There will be a hot chocolate and hot cider bar, music, photos, and good company to take your mind off of finals! Everyone is welcome!

Dear Smithies! 

We're happy to announce that Smithies in CS will be sponsoring a Volunteer TA Program starting next semester (details below). You can sign up by completing this form: http://tinyurl.com/np4kj65

> What is the Volunteer TA Program?
The Volunteer TA Program will give students a taster of what it's like to be a CS Department TA. Our volunteers will hold ~2 TA hours per week (alongside the Department TAs) and will be invited to attend the TA lunchtime workshops held throughout next semester.

> Why apply?
If you missed the deadline to apply to be a TA, or just didn't want to commit to 5-7 hours a week, this program is for you! Everyone - regardless of their major - who has taken at least 1 CS course (including just 102/103) is welcome to participate, and you can sign up by completing this form: http://tinyurl.com/np4kj65 

> Will I be paid?
Unfortunately, we will not be able to pay our volunteers. We would also like to emphasize that our Volunteer TA Program has no affiliation with the CS Department TA Program. Participation as a volunteer TA will have no impact on the Department's future TA hiring decisions. This is just a way for students to gain TA experience if they would like to do so.

> Where can I learn more?
We're working on adding a section to the website with more information, but for now you can learn more about the program here: http://tinyurl.com/q2r55kh 

Questions? Comments? Please email scs@smith.edu!

We are excited to announce that Smithies in CS now has a twitter. 

Follow us for updates and CS puns galore!

Need help preparing for your technical interview? Never fear! Google Software engineer, Daniel Nachbar, will be on campus to lead a workshop on technical interviewing and answer any questions you may have. If you have a pending technical interview or are thinking of completing one soon, don't miss this opportunity.

When: 4:00 to 5:30 on Wednesday, November 18th
Where: Campus Center, Room 102
Please RSVP here and we will confirm your attendance! http://goo.gl/qGwgv8

This opportunity is suitable for students in the Computer Science Department who have technical interviews scheduled or will soon have interviews.
Photographer: Sharon Vizcaino
story: Smithies in Computer Science added 33 new photos to the album: Arduino Learnathon \u2014 at Smith College.

message:
Smithies in CS invites YOU to come learn about the Arduino platform at our beginner-friendly Arduino Learnathon! 

Microcontroller kits will be provided, so come get hands-on experience building circuits and coding in the C/C++-based programming language. No experience necessary!

A big thank you to everyone who came out to have ice cream with us! We had a blast!

Photographer: Giovanna Diaz
story: Smithies in Computer Science added 13 new photos to the album: SCS Ice Cream Social Kickoff - 2014 \u2014 with EV Miguel at Smith College.

message:
In case you haven't heard, Smithies in CS is hosting an Ice Cream Social Kickoff this Friday, October 17 from 4:30-5:30pm in the CC TV Lounge!

We look forward to seeing you all there!

Want to be a stronger technical candidate? Head to the Carroll Room at 7pm on Tuesday, September 23 to find out how!

** All students considering a major in Computer Science, or enrolled in CSC 111, are highly encouraged to attend! **

message: We loved getting to talk to everyone at the Org Fair today! What a wonderful way to start the year.

"So far, around 8,000 people are expected to attend the sold-out event at the Phoenix Convention Center in early October. That would be up from 4,700 last year and almost quadruple the number in 2010."

How many Smithies will be attending this year?
